68namespace webrtc {
69class AudioSinkInterface;
70} // namespace webrtc
71
72namespace cricket {
73
74struct CryptoParams;
75
76// BaseChannel contains logic common to voice and video, including enable,
77// marshaling calls to a worker and network threads, and connection and media
78// monitors.
79//
80// BaseChannel assumes signaling and other threads are allowed to make
81// synchronous calls to the worker thread, the worker thread makes synchronous
82// calls only to the network thread, and the network thread can't be blocked by
83// other threads.
84// All methods with _n suffix must be called on network thread,
85// methods with _w suffix on worker thread
86// and methods with _s suffix on signaling thread.
87// Network and worker threads may be the same thread.
88//
89// WARNING! SUBCLASSES MUST CALL Deinit() IN THEIR DESTRUCTORS!
90// This is required to avoid a data race between the destructor modifying the
91// vtable, and the media channel's thread using BaseChannel as the
92// NetworkInterface.
93
94class BaseChannel : public ChannelInterface,
95 // TODO(tommi): Remove has_slots inheritance.
96 public sigslot::has_slots<>,
97 // TODO(tommi): Consider implementing these interfaces
98 // via composition.
99 public MediaChannel::NetworkInterface,
100 public webrtc::RtpPacketSinkInterface {
101 public:
102 // If |srtp_required| is true, the channel will not send or receive any
103 // RTP/RTCP packets without using SRTP (either using SDES or DTLS-SRTP).
104 // The BaseChannel does not own the UniqueRandomIdGenerator so it is the
105 // responsibility of the user to ensure it outlives this object.
106 // TODO(zhihuang:) Create a BaseChannel::Config struct for the parameter lists
107 // which will make it easier to change the constructor.
108 BaseChannel(rtc::Thread* worker_thread,
109 rtc::Thread* network_thread,
110 rtc::Thread* signaling_thread,
111 std::unique_ptr<MediaChannel> media_channel,
112 const std::string& content_name,
113 bool srtp_required,
114 webrtc::CryptoOptions crypto_options,
115 rtc::UniqueRandomIdGenerator* ssrc_generator);
116 virtual ~BaseChannel();
117 virtual void Init_w(webrtc::RtpTransportInternal* rtp_transport);
118
119 // Deinit may be called multiple times and is simply ignored if it's already
120 // done.
121 void Deinit();
122
123 rtc::Thread* worker_thread() const { return worker_thread_; }
124 rtc::Thread* network_thread() const { return network_thread_; }
125 const std::string& content_name() const override { return content_name_; }
126 // TODO(deadbeef): This is redundant; remove this.
127 const std::string& transport_name() const override {
128 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(network_thread());
129 if (rtp_transport_)
130 return rtp_transport_->transport_name();
131 // TODO(tommi): Delete this variable.
132 return transport_name_;
133 }
134
135 // This function returns true if using SRTP (DTLS-based keying or SDES).
136 bool srtp_active() const {
137 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(network_thread());
138 return rtp_transport_ && rtp_transport_->IsSrtpActive();
139 }
140
141 // Set an RTP level transport which could be an RtpTransport without
142 // encryption, an SrtpTransport for SDES or a DtlsSrtpTransport for DTLS-SRTP.
143 // This can be called from any thread and it hops to the network thread
144 // internally. It would replace the |SetTransports| and its variants.
145 bool SetRtpTransport(webrtc::RtpTransportInternal* rtp_transport) override;
146
147 webrtc::RtpTransportInternal* rtp_transport() const {
148 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(network_thread());
149 return rtp_transport_;
150 }
151
152 // Channel control
153 bool SetLocalContent(const MediaContentDescription* content,
154 webrtc::SdpType type,
155 std::string* error_desc) override;
156 bool SetRemoteContent(const MediaContentDescription* content,
157 webrtc::SdpType type,
158 std::string* error_desc) override;
159 // Controls whether this channel will receive packets on the basis of
160 // matching payload type alone. This is needed for legacy endpoints that
161 // don't signal SSRCs or use MID/RID, but doesn't make sense if there is
162 // more than channel of specific media type, As that creates an ambiguity.
163 //
164 // This method will also remove any existing streams that were bound to this
165 // channel on the basis of payload type, since one of these streams might
166 // actually belong to a new channel. See: crbug.com/webrtc/11477
167 bool SetPayloadTypeDemuxingEnabled(bool enabled) override;
168
169 void Enable(bool enable) override;
170
171 const std::vector<StreamParams>& local_streams() const override {
172 return local_streams_;
173 }
174 const std::vector<StreamParams>& remote_streams() const override {
175 return remote_streams_;
176 }
177
178 // Used for latency measurements.
179 void SetFirstPacketReceivedCallback(std::function<void()> callback) override;
180
181 // From RtpTransport - public for testing only
182 void OnTransportReadyToSend(bool ready);
183
184 // Only public for unit tests. Otherwise, consider protected.
185 int SetOption(SocketType type, rtc::Socket::Option o, int val) override;
186
187 // RtpPacketSinkInterface overrides.
188 void OnRtpPacket(const webrtc::RtpPacketReceived& packet) override;
189
190 MediaChannel* media_channel() const override {
191 return media_channel_.get();
192 }
193
194 protected:
195 bool was_ever_writable() const {
196 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
197 return was_ever_writable_;
198 }
199 void set_local_content_direction(webrtc::RtpTransceiverDirection direction) {
200 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
201 local_content_direction_ = direction;
202 }
203 void set_remote_content_direction(webrtc::RtpTransceiverDirection direction) {
204 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
205 remote_content_direction_ = direction;
206 }
207 // These methods verify that:
208 // * The required content description directions have been set.
209 // * The channel is enabled.
210 // * And for sending:
211 // - The SRTP filter is active if it's needed.
212 // - The transport has been writable before, meaning it should be at least
213 // possible to succeed in sending a packet.
214 //
215 // When any of these properties change, UpdateMediaSendRecvState_w should be
216 // called.
217 bool IsReadyToReceiveMedia_w() const RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
218 bool IsReadyToSendMedia_w() const RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
219 rtc::Thread* signaling_thread() const { return signaling_thread_; }
220
221 // NetworkInterface implementation, called by MediaEngine
222 bool SendPacket(rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer* packet,
223 const rtc::PacketOptions& options) override;
224 bool SendRtcp(rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer* packet,
225 const rtc::PacketOptions& options) override;
226
227 // From RtpTransportInternal
228 void OnWritableState(bool writable);
229
230 void OnNetworkRouteChanged(absl::optional<rtc::NetworkRoute> network_route);
231
232 bool SendPacket(bool rtcp,
233 rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer* packet,
234 const rtc::PacketOptions& options);
235
236 void EnableMedia_w() RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
237 void DisableMedia_w() RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
238
239 // Performs actions if the RTP/RTCP writable state changed. This should
240 // be called whenever a channel's writable state changes or when RTCP muxing
241 // becomes active/inactive.
242 void UpdateWritableState_n() RTC_RUN_ON(network_thread());
243 void ChannelWritable_n() RTC_RUN_ON(network_thread());
244 void ChannelNotWritable_n() RTC_RUN_ON(network_thread());
245
246 bool AddRecvStream_w(const StreamParams& sp) RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
247 bool RemoveRecvStream_w(uint32_t ssrc) RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
248 void ResetUnsignaledRecvStream_w() RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
249 bool SetPayloadTypeDemuxingEnabled_w(bool enabled)
250 RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
251 bool AddSendStream_w(const StreamParams& sp) RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
252 bool RemoveSendStream_w(uint32_t ssrc) RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
253
254 // Should be called whenever the conditions for
255 // IsReadyToReceiveMedia/IsReadyToSendMedia are satisfied (or unsatisfied).
256 // Updates the send/recv state of the media channel.
257 virtual void UpdateMediaSendRecvState_w() RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread()) = 0;
258
259 bool UpdateLocalStreams_w(const std::vector<StreamParams>& streams,
260 webrtc::SdpType type,
261 std::string* error_desc)
262 RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
263 bool UpdateRemoteStreams_w(const std::vector<StreamParams>& streams,
264 webrtc::SdpType type,
265 std::string* error_desc)
266 RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
267 virtual bool SetLocalContent_w(const MediaContentDescription* content,
268 webrtc::SdpType type,
269 std::string* error_desc)
270 RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread()) = 0;
271 virtual bool SetRemoteContent_w(const MediaContentDescription* content,
272 webrtc::SdpType type,
273 std::string* error_desc)
274 RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread()) = 0;
275 // Return a list of RTP header extensions with the non-encrypted extensions
276 // removed depending on the current crypto_options_ and only if both the
277 // non-encrypted and encrypted extension is present for the same URI.
278 RtpHeaderExtensions GetFilteredRtpHeaderExtensions(
279 const RtpHeaderExtensions& extensions);
280
281 // Add |payload_type| to |demuxer_criteria_| if payload type demuxing is
282 // enabled.
283 void MaybeAddHandledPayloadType(int payload_type) RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
284
285 void ClearHandledPayloadTypes() RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
286
287 void UpdateRtpHeaderExtensionMap(
288 const RtpHeaderExtensions& header_extensions);
289
290 bool RegisterRtpDemuxerSink_w() RTC_RUN_ON(worker_thread());
291
292 // Return description of media channel to facilitate logging
293 std::string ToString() const;
294
295 private:
296 bool ConnectToRtpTransport() RTC_RUN_ON(network_thread());
297 void DisconnectFromRtpTransport() RTC_RUN_ON(network_thread());
298 void SignalSentPacket_n(const rtc::SentPacket& sent_packet);
299
300 rtc::Thread* const worker_thread_;
301 rtc::Thread* const network_thread_;
302 rtc::Thread* const signaling_thread_;
303 rtc::scoped_refptr<webrtc::PendingTaskSafetyFlag> alive_;
304
305 const std::string content_name_;
306
307 std::function<void()> on_first_packet_received_
308 RTC_GUARDED_BY(network_thread());
309
310 // Won't be set when using raw packet transports. SDP-specific thing.
311 // TODO(bugs.webrtc.org/12230): Written on network thread, read on
312 // worker thread (at least).
313 // TODO(tommi): Remove this variable and instead use rtp_transport_ to
314 // return the transport name. This variable is currently required for
315 // "for_test" methods.
316 std::string transport_name_;
317
318 webrtc::RtpTransportInternal* rtp_transport_
319 RTC_GUARDED_BY(network_thread()) = nullptr;
320
321 std::vector<std::pair<rtc::Socket::Option, int> > socket_options_
322 RTC_GUARDED_BY(network_thread());
323 std::vector<std::pair<rtc::Socket::Option, int> > rtcp_socket_options_
324 RTC_GUARDED_BY(network_thread());
325 bool writable_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(network_thread()) = false;
326 bool was_ever_writable_n_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(network_thread()) = false;
327 bool was_ever_writable_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(worker_thread()) = false;
328 const bool srtp_required_ = true;
329
330 // TODO(tommi): This field shouldn't be necessary. It's a copy of
331 // PeerConnection::GetCryptoOptions(), which is const state. It's also only
332 // used to filter header extensions when calling
333 // `rtp_transport_->UpdateRtpHeaderExtensionMap()` when the local/remote
334 // content description is updated. Since the transport is actually owned
335 // by the transport controller that also gets updated whenever the content
336 // description changes, it seems we have two paths into the transports, along
337 // with several thread hops via various classes (such as the Channel classes)
338 // that only serve as additional layers and store duplicate state. The Jsep*
339 // family of classes already apply session description updates on the network
340 // thread every time it changes.
341 // For the Channel classes, we should be able to get rid of:
342 // * crypto_options (and fewer construction parameters)_
343 // * UpdateRtpHeaderExtensionMap
344 // * GetFilteredRtpHeaderExtensions
345 // * Blocking thread hop to the network thread for every call to set
346 // local/remote content is updated.
347 const webrtc::CryptoOptions crypto_options_;
348
349 // MediaChannel related members that should be accessed from the worker
350 // thread.
351 const std::unique_ptr<MediaChannel> media_channel_;
352 // Currently the |enabled_| flag is accessed from the signaling thread as
353 // well, but it can be changed only when signaling thread does a synchronous
354 // call to the worker thread, so it should be safe.
355 bool enabled_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(worker_thread()) = false;
356 bool enabled_s_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(signaling_thread()) = false;
357 bool payload_type_demuxing_enabled_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(worker_thread()) = true;
358 std::vector<StreamParams> local_streams_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(worker_thread());
359 std::vector<StreamParams> remote_streams_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(worker_thread());
360 // TODO(bugs.webrtc.org/12230): local_content_direction and
361 // remote_content_direction are set on the worker thread, but accessed on the
362 // network thread.
363 webrtc::RtpTransceiverDirection local_content_direction_ =
364 webrtc::RtpTransceiverDirection::kInactive;
365 webrtc::RtpTransceiverDirection remote_content_direction_ =
366 webrtc::RtpTransceiverDirection::kInactive;
367
368 // Cached list of payload types, used if payload type demuxing is re-enabled.
369 std::set<uint8_t> payload_types_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(worker_thread());
370 // TODO(bugs.webrtc.org/12239): Modified on worker thread, accessed
371 // on network thread in RegisterRtpDemuxerSink_n (called from Init_w)
372 webrtc::RtpDemuxerCriteria demuxer_criteria_;
373 // Accessed on the worker thread, modified on the network thread from
374 // RegisterRtpDemuxerSink_w's Invoke.
375 webrtc::RtpDemuxerCriteria previous_demuxer_criteria_;
376 // This generator is used to generate SSRCs for local streams.
377 // This is needed in cases where SSRCs are not negotiated or set explicitly
378 // like in Simulcast.
379 // This object is not owned by the channel so it must outlive it.
380 rtc::UniqueRandomIdGenerator* const ssrc_generator_;
381};
382
383// VoiceChannel is a specialization that adds support for early media, DTMF,
384// and input/output level monitoring.
385class VoiceChannel : public BaseChannel {
386 public:
387 VoiceChannel(rtc::Thread* worker_thread,
388 rtc::Thread* network_thread,
389 rtc::Thread* signaling_thread,
390 std::unique_ptr<VoiceMediaChannel> channel,
391 const std::string& content_name,
392 bool srtp_required,
393 webrtc::CryptoOptions crypto_options,
394 rtc::UniqueRandomIdGenerator* ssrc_generator);
395 ~VoiceChannel();
396
397 // downcasts a MediaChannel
398 VoiceMediaChannel* media_channel() const override {
399 return static_cast<VoiceMediaChannel*>(BaseChannel::media_channel());
400 }
401
402 cricket::MediaType media_type() const override {
403 return cricket::MEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO;
404 }
405
406 private:
407 // overrides from BaseChannel
408 void UpdateMediaSendRecvState_w() override;
409 bool SetLocalContent_w(const MediaContentDescription* content,
410 webrtc::SdpType type,
411 std::string* error_desc) override;
412 bool SetRemoteContent_w(const MediaContentDescription* content,
413 webrtc::SdpType type,
414 std::string* error_desc) override;
415
416 // Last AudioSendParameters sent down to the media_channel() via
417 // SetSendParameters.
418 AudioSendParameters last_send_params_;
419 // Last AudioRecvParameters sent down to the media_channel() via
420 // SetRecvParameters.
421 AudioRecvParameters last_recv_params_;
422};
423
424// VideoChannel is a specialization for video.
425class VideoChannel : public BaseChannel {
426 public:
427 VideoChannel(rtc::Thread* worker_thread,
428 rtc::Thread* network_thread,
429 rtc::Thread* signaling_thread,
430 std::unique_ptr<VideoMediaChannel> media_channel,
431 const std::string& content_name,
432 bool srtp_required,
433 webrtc::CryptoOptions crypto_options,
434 rtc::UniqueRandomIdGenerator* ssrc_generator);
435 ~VideoChannel();
436
437 // downcasts a MediaChannel
438 VideoMediaChannel* media_channel() const override {
439 return static_cast<VideoMediaChannel*>(BaseChannel::media_channel());
440 }
441
442 void FillBitrateInfo(BandwidthEstimationInfo* bwe_info);
443
444 cricket::MediaType media_type() const override {
445 return cricket::MEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO;
446 }
447
448 private:
449 // overrides from BaseChannel
450 void UpdateMediaSendRecvState_w() override;
451 bool SetLocalContent_w(const MediaContentDescription* content,
452 webrtc::SdpType type,
453 std::string* error_desc) override;
454 bool SetRemoteContent_w(const MediaContentDescription* content,
455 webrtc::SdpType type,
456 std::string* error_desc) override;
457
458 // Last VideoSendParameters sent down to the media_channel() via
459 // SetSendParameters.
460 VideoSendParameters last_send_params_;
461 // Last VideoRecvParameters sent down to the media_channel() via
462 // SetRecvParameters.
463 VideoRecvParameters last_recv_params_;
464};
465
466} // namespace cricket
467
468#endif // PC_CHANNEL_H_
